S032N.FORM  Y. Col. 9 1. Sample of Negro enlisted men 2. Sample of White enlisted men

S032N.VI. Cross-Section Identification: E. While the complete sample for S-32 included a representative cross-section of 3000 Negro and 4800 white troops (AMS-032W) in the U.S. to be used for cross-section comparisons, the Negro sample was augmented to over 7400 to provide additional cases of better educated and of northern Negroes in order to permit comparisons of these subgroups within the Negro sample. - 2 - AMS-032N  C. Col. 10 1. Cross-section cases 2. All other cases
S032N.Q1. How old were you on your last birthday?  R. Col. 11 1. 19 years or younger 2. 20 years 3. 21 to 24 years 4. 25 to 27 5. 28 to 29 years 6. 30 to 34 years 7. 35 years or older 0. No Answer

S032N.Q2. How far did you go in school?  R. Cols. 12-13 01. Less than 4th grade 02. Finished 4th grade 03. Finished 5th grade 04. Finished 6th grade 05. Finished 7th grade 06. Finished 8th grade 07. Some high school or trade school 08. Graduated from high school 09. Some college but did not finish 10. Graduated from college 11. No Answer 00. No code or no data - 3 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q3. How did you come into the Army?  R. Col. 14 1. I was drafted 2. I volunteered 3. I was in the National Guard 4. No Answer 0. No code or no data X. Questions 4-5: Codes for branches of service which were not printed on original questionnaire not provided by survey organization (with the exception of "Air Corps" which was on the questionnaire without a code number).

S032N.Q4. What branch of the service are you in? (If your branch is not listed write it out)  R. Cols. 15-16 01. Cavalry 02. Engineers 03. Infantry 04. Field artillery 05. Signal corps 06. Medical corps 07. Ordnance Department 08. Quartermaster Corps 09. Chemical Warfare 10. Armored Force (Tank Corps) 11. Undesignated Code (possibly Air Corps) 12. Undesignated Code 13. Undesignated Code 14. Undesignated Code 00. No code or no data - 4 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q6. What kind of a chance is the Army giving you to show what you can do?  R. Col. 30 1. A very good chance 2. A fairly good chance 3. Undecided 4. Not much of a chance 5. No chance at all 0. No Answer

S032N.Q7. How do you feel about the bus service to and from camp for the soldiers in your outfit?  R. Col. 31 1. It is very good 2. It is fairly good 3. It is poor 4. It is very poor 5. Don't know 6. No Answer 0. No code or no data - 6 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q7a. Write any comments you have about bus service here:  C. Col. 32 1. Criticisms of operation (too crowded, too infrequent, too small, wait too long, schedules irregular, prices too high, etc.) 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q7a. Write any comments you have about bus service here:  C. Col. 33 40 1. Civilians treated better than soldiers 7402 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q7a. Write any comments you have about bus service here:  C. Col. 34 19 1. Officers treated better than enlisted men 7423 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q7a. Write any comments you have about bus service here:  C. Col. 35 924 1. Whites treated better than Negroes, "segregation", any racial comment 6518 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q7a. Write any comments you have about bus service here:  C. Col. 36 608 1. Merely a repetitious restatement of check-list answers (service is awful) 6834 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q7a. Write any comments you have about bus service here:  C. Col. 37 243 1. Other 7199 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q7a. Write any comments you have about bus service here:  C. Col. 38 4128 1. No comment 3314 2. Not chosen - 7 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q8. Do you think you might want to stay in the Army after the war?  R. Col. 39 1. Yes, I would want to very much 2. Yes, I might want to, but I'm not sure 3. No, I don't think I would want to 4. No, I would not want to at all 5. Undecided 0. No Answer

S032N.Q9. After the war do you think you would like to come back to your old outfit for two weeks of Army training every year?  R. Col. 40 1. Yes, I would want to very much 2. Yes, I might want to, but I'm not sure 3. No, I don't think I would want to 4. No, I would not want to at all 5. Undecided 0. No Answer

S032N.Q10. If you could go to any Army camp you wanted to, would you rather stay here or would you rather go to some other camp?  R. Col. 41 1. I would rather stay here 2. I would rather go to some other camp 3. Undecided 0. No Answer - 8 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q11. If you would like to go to any other Army camp in the United States, which one would you want to go to?  C. Cols. 42-43 01. Any general mention of "North" (any place outside the South, anywhere a Negro's treated like a man, anywhere North, etc.) 02. Any general mention of "South" 03. Any general mention of "West" 04. "Anywhere as long as it's U.S." 05. No answer, "Anywhere" 06. Inapplicable (Q.10 coded 1) 11. Maine 12. New Hampshire 13. Vermont 14. Massachusetts 15. Rhode Island 16. Connecticut 21. New York 22. New Jersey 23. Pennsylvania 31. Ohio 32. Indiana 33. Illinois 34. Michigan 35. Wisconsin 41. Minnesota 42. Iowa 43. Missouri 44. North Dakota 45. South Dakota 46. Nebraska 47. Kansas 51. Delaware 52. Maryland 53. District of Columbia 54. Virginia 55. West Virginia 56. North Carolina 57. South Carolina 58. Georgia 59. Florida 61. Kentucky 62. Tennessee 63. Alabama 64. Mississippi 71. Arkansas 72. Louisiana 73. Oklahoma - 9 - AMS-032N 74. Texas 81. Montana 82. Idaho 83. Wyoming 84. Colorado 85. New Mexico 86. Arizona 87. Utah 88. Nevada 91. Washington 92. Oregon 93. California 94. Alaska 95. Hawaii 00. No code or no data

S032N.Q12. In general, where would you like best to be stationed?  R. Col. 44 1. In a camp in the North 2. In a camp in the South 3. In a camp in the West 4. Undecided 5. No Answer 0. No code or no data
S032N.Q12a. In general, where would you like best to be stationed? Why?  C. Col. 45 1. Closer to home, or family 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q12a. In general, where would you like best to be stationed? Why?  C. Col. 46 607 1. Habit (used to the South, or North, born there, etc.) 6835 2. Not chosen - 10 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q12a. In general, where would you like best to be stationed? Why?  C. Col. 47 2619 1. (Negro only) racial and/or sectional differences (better treatment in North, discrimination in south, etc.) 4823 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q12a. In general, where would you like best to be stationed? Why?  C. Col. 48 661 1. Prefer climate 6781 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q12a. In general, where would you like best to be stationed? Why?  C. Col. 49 85 1. Adventure (want to see places where I haven't been) 7357 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q12a. In general, where would you like best to be stationed? Why?  C. Col. 50 8 1. Farther from home (so I won't be close enough to home to feel homesick) 7434 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q12a. In general, where would you like best to be stationed? Why?  C. Col. 51 558 1. Restatement of preference without reasons given (I just like the South better) 6884 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q12a. In general, where would you like best to be stationed? Why?  C. Col. 52 23 1. Better Army training (specific military training) 7419 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q12a. In general, where would you like best to be stationed? Why?  C. Col. 53 339 1. Other 7103 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q12a. In general, where would you like best to be stationed? Why?  C. Col. 54 1585 1. No comment 5857 2. Not chosen - 11 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q14. Where were you living before you entered the Army?  R. Col. 57 1. On a farm or in the country 2. In a small town (fewer than 2,500 people) 3. In a town (with between 2,500 and 25,000 people) 4. In a city (between 25,000 and 100,000 people) 5. In a large city (more than 100,000 people) 0. No Answer - 13 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q15. Think for a minute about the different sergeants and corporals you have served with. How fair do most of them seem to be with their men?  R. Col. 58 1. Most of them are fair 2. About half are; half are not 3. Most of them are not fair 4. Undecided 0. No Answer
S032N.Q16. What is your own rank or grade?  R. Col 59 1. Private or private first class 2. Corporal or technician 5th grade 3. Sergeant (any grade) or technician 3rd or 4th grade 0. No Answer
S032N.Q17. If you are a private, do you want to be a noncom?  R. Col. 60 1. Yes 2. No 3. Undecided 4. Inapplicable (already noncom) 5. No Answer 0. No code or no data - 14 - AMS-032N
S032N.Q18. Do you want to be a commissioned Officer?  R. Col. 61 1. Yes 2. No 3. Undecided 0. No Answer
S032N.Q18a. (Do you want to be a Commissioned Officer?) If no, why not?  C. Col. 62 1. Lack of education 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q18a. (Do you want to be a Commissioned Officer?) If no, why not?  C. Col. 63 107 1. Health, physical condition, or age disqualify 7335 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q18a. (Do you want to be a Commissioned Officer?) If no, why not?  C. Col. 64 37 1. Not in Army long enough, need more experience 7405 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q18a. (Do you want to be a Commissioned Officer?) If no, why not?  C. Col. 65 64 1. Not good at (or don't want to) handling men or giving orders 7378 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q18a. (Do you want to be a Commissioned Officer?) If no, why not?  C. Col. 66 310 1. Simple statement of "I'm not qualified" - but no mention of reasons why not qualified 7132 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q18a. (Do you want to be a Commissioned Officer?) If no, why not?  C. Col. 67 372 1. Too much responsibility or work 7070 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q18a. (Do you want to be a Commissioned Officer?) If no, why not?  C. Col. 68 51 1. Would lose or be limited in choice of friends because of rank 7391 2. Not chosen - 15 - AMS-032N
S032N.Q18a. (Do you want to be a Commissioned Officer?) If no, why not?  C. Col. 69 81 1. Dislike or criticism of C.O.'s, including criticism of training of C.O.'s 7361 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q18a. (Do you want to be a Commissioned Officer?) If no, why not?  C. Col. 70 55 1. Belief that being a C.O. means staying in Army after the war 7387 2. Not chosen

S032N.Q18a. (Do you want to be a Commissioned Officer?) If no, why not?  C. Col. 71 294 1. Repetition of check list answer (I'd rather be a private or a non-com, I don't want to be a C.O., etc. 7148 2. Not chosen

S032N.Q18a. (Do you want to be a Commissioned Officer?) If no, why not?  C. Col. 72 197 1. (Negro only) Racial objections (Negro officers have no prestige; treated like privates; receive prejudiced treatment, have little opportunity for promotion, etc.) 7245 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q18a. (Do you want to be a Commissioned Officer?) If no, why not?  C. Col. 73 372 1. Other 7070 2. Not chosen
S032N.Q18a. (Do you want to be a Commissioned Officer?) If no, why not?  C. Col. 74 5021 1. Inapplicable, no comment 2421 2. Not chosen - 16 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q19. When did you come into the Army?  C. Col. 75 1. 12/1/42 - present; 3 months or less 2. 9/1/42 - 11/30/42; 3 months up to 6 months 3. 3/1/42 - 8/31/42; 6 months up to 1 year 4. 3/1/41 - 2/28/42; 1 year up to 2 years 5. Before 3/1/41; over 2 years 0. No Answer
S032N.Q20. How interested are you in your Army job?  R. Col. 76 1. Very much interested 2. A little but not much 3. Not interested at all 4. No Answer 0. No code or no data

S032N.Q21. What is your main Army job or duty? (What is your job called? For example, rifleman, orderly, stock clerk, electrician, or what?)  C. Col. 77 1. Combat job 2. Non-combat, professional or clerical 3. Non-combat, skilled 4. Non-combat, semi-skilled and unskilled 5. Combat and technical 6. Basic training 7. Unclassified 8. No Answer 0. No code or no data - 17 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q22. Do the men in your company or battery cooperate, and work well together?  R. Col. 78 1. Yes, all of the time 2. Yes, most of the time 3. No, often do not 4. No, almost never do 5. Undecided 6. No Answer 0. No code or no data

S032N.Q23. In general, what sort of a time do you have in the Army?  R. Col. 79 1. I have a pretty good time 2. It is about fifty-fifty 3. I have a pretty rotten time 4. No Answer 0. No code or no data X. Col. 80 not used. CARD 2

S032N.Q24. Do you usually feel that what you are doing in the Army is worthwhile or not?  R. Col. 11 1. I usually feel it is not worthwhile 2. I usually feel it is worthwhile 3. Undecided 4. No Answer 0. No code or no data
S032N.Q25. Do you feel proud of your company or battery?  R. Col. 12 1. Yes, very proud 2. Yes, fairly proud 3. No, not proud 4. Undecided 0. No Answer - 19 - AMS-032N
S032N.Q26. Are you ever worried and upset?  R. Col. 13 1. I am hardly ever worried and upset 2. I am sometimes 3. I am often worried and upset 0. No Anser
S032N.Q27. Do you think you can make good in the army?  R. Col. 14 1. I feel pretty sure I can make good 2. I am not so sure I can make good 3. Undecided 4. No Answer 0. No code or no data

S032N.Q28. How would you say you felt most of the time, satisfied and in good spirits or dissatisfied and in low spirits?  R. Col. 15 1. Satisfied and in good spirits 2. I am up half the time and down half the time 3. Dissatisfied and in low spirits 0. No Answer

S032N.Q29. How much longer do you think this war will last?  C. Cols. 16-17 01. Less than a year or just "1943" 02. One year 03. Over one to less than two years, "1944" 04. Two years 05. Over two but less than three years, "1945" 06. Three years 07. Over three years 08. Indefinite answer indicating a short time (not long) 09. Indefinite answer indicating a long time (several years yet) - 20 - AMS-032N 10. Indefinite answer with no indication of time (will last until we stop it) 11. Don't know, undecided 12. No Answer

S032N.Q30. If it were up to you, what kind of outfit would you rather be in?  R. Col. 18 1. In a combat outfit overseas 2. In a non-combat outfit overseas 3. In an outfit that will stay in the United States 4. No Answer 0. No code or no data

S032N.Q31. If your outfit went overseas, would you rather have an actual fighting job or have some other job?  R. Col. 19 1. I would rather have an actual fighting job 2. I would rather have some other job 3. Undecided 0. No Answer

S032N.Q32. If it were up to you to choose, do you think you could do more for your country as a soldier or as a worker in a war job?  R. Col. 20 1. As a soldier 2. As a war worker 3. Undecided 4. No Answer 0. No code or no data - 21 - AMS-032N
S032N.Q33. Do you think there will be another war in the next 25 years or so?  R. Col. 21 1. Yes 2. No 3. Undecided 4. No Answer 0. No code or no data

S032N.Q34. If you think there will be another war, who do you think will be fighting whom?  C. Cols. 22-23 01. Civil War or race war in U.S. 02. Dark against light races on an International scale 03. Russia with dark allies only (China, Japan, Africa, India) against any other nation or combination of nations 04. Russia with one or more of axis nations besides Japan against any other nation or combination of nations 05. Russia with one or more allied nations besides China against any other nation or combination of nations 06. Russia with no allies against any other nation or combination of nations 07. Communism vs. Capitalism 08. World War III - any line up like World Wars I and II - (same set up as last time, those defeated now fighting the winners) 09. Russia is involved, but everything else is indeterminable 10. Race war but whether U.S. or International not stated 11. Unclassifiable combinations 12. No answer, don't know, inapplicable 00. No code or no data - 22 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q35. Up to now, has the war made things better or worse for your family and friends back home (such things as jobs, pay, and living conditions)?  R. Col. 24 1. Things are a lot better 2. Things are a little better, but not much 3. I don't see any difference 4. Things are a little worse 5. Things are a lot worse 6. Don't know 0. No Answer

S032N.Q36. Are you:  R. Col. 25 1. Single, and not engaged 2. Single and engaged 3. Married 4. Divorced 5. Separated (before you went into the Army) 6. Widowed 0. No Answer Z. If a man checks single, divorced, or widowed to Q.36: Edit answers to Q.37 and Q.39 as "not married", Q.38 should be coded as is. - 23 - AMS-032N
S032N.Q37. Were you married before or after entering the Army?  R. Col. 26 1. I'm not married 2. Married before entering the Army 3. Married after entering the Army 4. No Answer 0. No code or no data
S032N.Q38. How many children do you have?  R. Col. 27 1. I'm not married 2. Have no children 3. Have one child 4. Have two children 5. Have three or more children 6. No Answer 0. No code or no data
S032N.Q39. Is your wife now expecting a baby?  R. Col. 28 1. I'm not married 2. Yes 3. No 4. Don't know 5. No Answer 0. No code or no data - 24 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q40. Do you think that after the war soldiers in your outfit will find it easier or harder to get jobs than they did before the war?  R. Col. 29 1. Easier than before the war 2. About the same 3. Harder than before the war 4. Undecided 5. No Answer 0. No code or no data

S032N.Q41. Do you think that after the war the training you are getting in the Army will or will not help you to get a better job than you had before you went in the Army?  R. Col. 30 1. Will help me to get a better job 2. Will not help me to get a better job 3. Undecided 4. No Answer 0. No code or no data
S032N.Q42. Do you think this war is as much your affair as it is anybody else's?  R. Col. 31 1. Yes 2. No 3. Undecided 4. No Answer 0. No code or no data - 25 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q42a. Why or why not?  C. Cols. 32-33 01. Yes, statement of patriotism, duty, etc. (this is my country, I am an American, protect my country and home) 02. Yes, idealistic aims (we're all fighting for freedom, we got to see that this doesn't happen again) 03. Yes, answer indicating things could be worse and any racialist comment (nobody wants to go back to the feudal age, we know where we stand here - nobody knows what the axis would do) 04. Yes, unclassified answer 05. Yes, no comment 06. No, political or isolationist answer and uninformed about war aims (we wouldn't be in it except for big shots in Washington, D.C., let the British fight their own war) 07. No, racialist answer (we are 'Jim-crowed, I am a Negro, the axis attacked the white man) 08. No, sore at the draft (I should never have been drafted, I have flat feet) 09. No, unclassified answers 10. No, no comment 11. Undecided, racialist comments 12. Undecided, other comments 13. Undecided, no comment 14. No answer to Q.42 00. No code or no data

S032N.Q43. How do you think this war will come out?  R. Col. 34 1. It will be a complete victory for us 2. We will win, but it won't be a complete victory 3. It will end in a draw 4. The other side has a pretty good chance of winning 5. Undecided 6. No Answer 0. No code or no data - 26 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q44. After the war do you think that you yourself will have more rights and privileges or less rights and privileges than you had before the war?  R. Col. 35 1. More rights and privileges than before the war 2. Less rights and privileges than before the war 3. About the same as before the war 4. Undecided 0. No Answer
S032N.Q45. Do you think that one of the things the United States is fighting for is to give everybody a fair chance to make a decent living?  R. Col. 36 1. Yes 2. No 3. Undecided 0. No Answer

S032N.Q46. Do you think that the United States is fighting mainly for the benefit of the rich people in this country?  R. Col. 37 1. Yes 2. No 3. Undecided 4. No Answer 0. No code or no data - 27 - AMS-032N
S032N.Q47. Do you think that one of the things the United States is fighting for is to protect the right of free speech for everyone?  R. Col. 38 1. Yes 2. No 3. Undecided 0. No Answer

S032N.Q48. If Germany and Japan were to offer to stop fighting now and to give up the countries they have taken over, do you think we should talk peace with them or not?  R. Col. 39 1. We should talk peace now 2. We should keep on fighting until they are crushed 3. Undecided 0. No Answer X. Q.49. not coded by survey organization.

S032N.Q50. Which of these things do you think Negroes back home in civilian life should try hardest to do now?  R. Col. 40 1. Try hardest to make things better for the Negro 2. Try hardest to win the war first 3. Try to do both at the same time 4. Undecided 0. No Answer

S032N.Q50a. Which of these things do you think Negroes back home in civilian life should try hardest to do now: further comments?  C. Cols. 41-42 11. Try hardest to make things better for the Negro: this is our best, only, most opportune time, chance, etc. 12. Better for the Negro: if conditions were bettered Negroes would support the war (have improved morale) 13. Better for the Negro: ought to establish democracy at home before we try to give it to the world 14. Better for the Negro: a matter of division of labor (soldiers will work to win the war; civilians, to make things better for the Negro) 15. Better for the Negro: a simple statement of Negro sufferings (Negroes have a hard time) 16. Better for the Negro: a statement indicating acceptance of a "both" position (at the same time we should try to win the war) 17. Better for the Negro: other comments 18. Better for the Negro: no comments 21. Try hardest to win the war first: the war is most important now 22. Win the war: there will be more time or a better chance to improve Negro conditions after the war, or "things will be better" 23. Win the war: after the war concentrate on improving Negro conditions - 29 - AMS-032N 24. Win the war: Negroes can (must or will) demonstrate or earn in the war their right to better treatment, or, things will naturally be better 25. Win the war: a statement indicating a "both" position (at the same time we should try to better conditions) 26. Win the war: other comments 27. Win the war: no comments 31. Try to do both at the same time: this is the best or only way to improve things, the opportune moment, the proper method, etc. (if we wait until after, things will be as before) 32. Both: Negroes have a duty both to themselves and their country 33. Both: A matter of division of labor (civilians can do both; soldiers cannot) 34. Both: It will have a good effect on Negro morale 35. Both: A simple statement of Negro sufferings (negroes in America do not have an equal chance) 36. Both: a statement implying "win the war first" (war must be finished before Negro can do better) 37. Both: A statement implying "better for the Negro first" (try to get Negroes their rights) 38. Both: other comment 39. Both: no comment 41. Undecided: Comment implying win war first 42. Undecided: Comment implying better for Negroes 43. Undecided: Comment implying both 44. Undecided: Comment not classifiable 45. Undecided: No comment or comment merely repeats undecided 51. No Answer: Comment implying win the war first 52. No Answer: Comment implying better for Negro 53. No Answer: Comment implying both 54. No Answer: Comment unclassifiable 55. No Answer: No comment 00. No code or no data - 30 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q51. Do you think that after the war you will be treated better or worse by white people than you were before the war?  R. Col. 43 1. Better 2. About the same 3. Worse 4. Undecided 5. No Answer 0. No code or no data

S032N.Q51a. Do you think that after the war you will be treated better or worse by white people than you were before the war: Why?  C. Cols. 44-45 01. Better: a militant answer (we will take it, demand it; fight for it) 02. Better: an historical answer (gains were made after last war, present improvements already visible because we are now more intelligent or educated) 03. Better: a virtue will be rewarded answer (it will be because it ought to be, after whites have seen our patriotism, they will change their attitude, we are all fighting together, whites will realize the futulity of their position, we are showing we are loyal, educated, etc.) 04. Better: racial contacts answer and war is bringing us closer (there will be more association and better understanding between whites and Negroes through contacts in Army, etc.) 05. Better: a statement of the specific ways in which it will be better (we'll be allowed to vote, there'll be less discrimination, we will be better educated) 06. Better: a war aims answer (that is what we're fighting this war for, we're all fighting for the same thing, etc.) 07. Better: an inevitability of change answer (wars always change things, changes are always occurring, Negroes can't be kept down forever, promised by God) 08. Better: other answer 09. Better: no answer - 31 - AMS-032N 11. About the same: an historical answer (nothing changed after the last war, haven't seen any sign of change so far, etc.) 12. About the same: a time perspective answer (only time can change things like this, it will take generations to modify race attitudes, a war won't do it - it'll take education, etc.) 13. About the same: a distrustful cynical answer and militant (whites always make promises when they need us, then take them back after the war) 14. About the same: a resigned accepting answer (whites won't let Negroes rise, we'll never get further than the level whites have set for us, wars won't alter white attitudes, things will always be the same, white people hate Negroes) 15. About the same: other answer 16. About the same: no answer 21. Worse: an historical answer (things are getting worse now, look at how they're treating Negro soldiers) 22. Worse: a resigned defeated answer (whites are never going to treat Negroes fairly, etc) 23. Worse: a prediction of reaction after the war (Negroes will lose the gains they've made southerners will act more harshly in order to stamp out any ideas the Negroes may have gotten in the Army, etc.) 24. Worse: other answer 25. Worse: no answer 31. Undecided: with or without comments 32. No answer to Q.50, with or without comments 00. No code or no data

More rights and privileges: militant answer (we will take it, demand it; fight for it) 02. More: historical answer (gains were made after last war, present improvements already visible) 03. More: virtue will be rewarded answer (it will be because it ought to be, after whites have seen our patriotism, they will change their attitude, we are helping to win the war so should be treated better, we are all fighting together, whites will realize the futility of their position, we are showing we are loyal, educated, etc.) - 33 - AMS-032N 04. More: racial contacts answer (there will be more association and better understanding between whites and Negroes through contacts in Army, etc.) 05. More: statement of the specific ways in which it will be better (we'll be allowed to vote, there'll be less discrimination) 06. More: a war aims answer (that's what we're fighting this war for, we're all fighting for the same thing, etc.) 07. More: Inevitability of change answer (wars always change things, changes are always occurring, Negroes can't be kept down forever) 08. More: other answer 09. More: no answer 11. About the same: an historical answer (nothing changed after the last war, haven't seen any signs of change so far, etc.) 12. About the same: time perspective answer (only time can change things like this, it will take generations to modify race attitudes, etc.) 13. About the same: distrustful cynical answer (whites always make promises when they need us, then take them back after the war) 14. About the same: resigned accepting answer (whites won't let Negroes rise, we'll never get further than the level whites have set for us, wars won't alter white attitudes, things will always be the same, white people hate Negroes) 15. About the same: other answer 16. About the same: no answer 21. Less rights and privileges: an historical answer (things are getting worse now, look at how they're treating Negro soldiers) 22. Less: resigned defeated answer (whites are never going to treat Negroes fair, etc.) 23. Less: prediction of reaction after the war (Negroes will lose the gains they've made, southerners will act more harshly in order to stamp out any ideas the Negroes may have gotten in the Army, etc.) 24. Less: other answer 25. Less: no answer 31. Undecided: with or without comments 32. No answer to Q.54, with or without comments 00. No code or no data - 34 - AMS-032N

S032N.Q74a. Do you think it is a good idea or a poor idea for white and Negro soldiers to have separate PX's in army camps: write any comments here?  11. Good idea: the existence of prejudice (whites don't want to be with colored, there might be trouble and misunderstanding, it's necessary in the locality where I'm stationed etc.) 12. Good idea: because of principle (the race ought to be kept separate, Negroes and whites should associate with own race only, the idea is all right, but the Negro accommodations should be equal to the whites, etc.) 13. Good idea: comment cannot clearly be classified as either existence of prejudice or as principle (we just don't mix, we never would get along, each one would know his own place) 14. Good idea: no comment 21. Poor idea: and statements of equality, democracy, justice, etc. as principles (that's what we're fighting for - democracy, why not - we're all fighting for the same thing, we're all American soldiers) - 41 - AMS-032N 22. Poor idea: belief or hope that closer association would bring better understanding between the races (we'll never improve conditions until we intermingle and learn to understand each other, a friendlier feeling would be promoted, the whites would see what we can do and would respect us more) 23. Poor idea: other comments 24. Poor idea: no comments 31. Undecided: existence of prejudice 32. Undecided: principle 33. Undecided: not clearly existence of prejudice or principle 34. Undecided: no comment 00. No Answer

S032N.Q77a. Do you think white and Negro soldiers should be in separate outfits or should they be together in the same outfits: write any comments here?  11. Separate outfits: the existence of prejudice (whites don't want to be with colored, there might be trouble and misunderstanding, it's necessary in the locality where I'm stationed etc.) 12. Separate outfits: because of principle (the races ought to be kept separate, Negroes and whites should associate with own race only, the idea is all right, but the Negro accommodations should be equal to the whites, etc.) 13. Separate outfits: comment cannot clearly be classified as either existence of prejudice or as principle (we just don't mix, we never would get along, each one would know his own place) 14. Separate outfits: no comment 21. Same outfits: statements of equality, democracy, justice, etc. as principles (that's what we're fighting for - democracy, why not - we're all fighting for the same things, we're all American soldiers) 22. Same outfits: belief or hope that closer association would bring better understanding between the races (we'll never improve conditions until we intermingle and learn to understand each other, a friendlier feeling would be promoted, the whites would see what we can do and would respect us more) - 44 - AMS-032N 23. Same outfits: other comment 24. Same outfits: no comment 31. Doesn't make any difference: comment implies non-segregation because of belief in democracy, etc. 32. Doesn't make any difference: comment implies acceptance of segregation because of the existence of prejudice 34.
